message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.SY, cs.CE, cs.AI

The paper proposes a new simulation paradigm using neural networks for predicting vessel dynamics in extreme sea states. This falls under the category of machine learning and artificial intelligence, which is covered by several sub-categories in arXiv CS. The paper specifically uses recurrent neural networks (RNNs), which are commonly used in natural language processing and time series analysis, and more specifically, the paper compares the performance of standard RNNs versus GRU and LSTM neural networks (NNs). This suggests that the paper may fall under the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper deals with a complex engineering problem and involves the use of computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations, which suggests that it may also fall under the sub-categories of cs.CE (Computational Engineering) and cs.SY (Systems and Control).
